reply.question: 1. Does the app declare the collection of data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the collection of data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that personal data is collected and processed for various purposes, indicating that data collection is indeed declared by the app.
reply.reference: Throughout this Privacy Policy, the term 'processing' is used, which includes all operations involving Personal data, including without limitation, collection, handling, storage, sharing, access, use, transfer and deletion of Personal data. URL: https://peakpath.com/privacy-policy

source_documents.excerpt:
At Nudge Labs AB ("PeakPath", "we", "us" or “our”), we protect your privacy and strive towards always maintaining a high level of data protection.
This Privacy Policy describes how we collect and use Personal data that is provided to us via our website www.peakpath.com or our application PeakPath, and when our services are used. It also describes your rights and how you can exercise them. If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact us at dpo@peakpath.com.

reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects the following types of data: Identity information, Contact information, User-generated data, Demographic data, Your communication, Geographical information, Health information, Results regarding your work environment, Information about feedback.

reply.analysis: The types of data collected by the app are explicitly listed in the Privacy Policy under different categories, providing a comprehensive view of the data collection activities.
reply.reference:
Identity information
Contact information
User-generated data
Demographic data
Your communication
Geographical information
Health information
Results regarding your work environment
Information about feedback
URL: https://peakpath.com/privacy-policy

reply.question: 3. Does the app declare the purpose of data collection and use?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the purpose of data collection and use.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy explicitly states that your personal data is processed to evaluate, develop, and improve services, products, and systems. It also mentions customizing services, analyzing how the application or website is used, and conducting research with user consent.
reply.reference: The processing is necessary to fulfill our legitimate interest in evaluating, developing and improving our services, products and systems. URL: https://peakpath.com/privacy-policy. We process your Personal data when customizing services to become more performant and effective. In order to analyze and better understand how you use our application or website, we further process your Personal data, which we e.g. as collected via cookies, application performance monitoring or similar technologies. URL: https://peakpath.com/privacy-policy. If we have your consent, we may process your Personal data as provided and generated when you use our services to conduct research. URL: https://peakpath.com/privacy-policy.

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the user can opt out of data collection or delete data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy states that users have the right to object to the processing of their Personal data, have their data erased, or request the restriction of processing under certain circumstances. This indicates that users can opt out of data collection or have their data deleted.
reply.reference: You can object to processing of your Personal data if it is based on a legitimate interest or if the processing is not necessary to establish, exercise and defend legal claims. If we are unable to demonstrate compelling legitimate grounds to continue processing, that override your interests, or if the processing is not necessary to establish, exercise and defend legal claims, we are obliged to cease the processing. You can have your Personal data erased under certain circumstances. URL: https://peakpath.com/privacy-policy

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?

answer.full_answer: No data is shared with external parties except for anonymized and minimized data with selected universities, institutions, and other parties for research purposes.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that personal identifiable information is not shared with external parties. Instead, only anonymized and minimized data is shared for research purposes with selected universities, institutions, and other parties.
reply.reference: For the avoidance of doubt, we do not share any Personal Identifiable Information (PII) with such external parties. URL: https://peakpath.com/privacy-policy

reply.question: 6. If the app shares data with third parties, what third parties does the app share data with?

answer.full_answer: The app shares data with service providers that manage necessary operations, technical support, maintenance of services, and IT systems.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy states that personal data is shared with service providers for managing operations, technical support, and IT systems. These service providers are only allowed to process data as per explicit instructions.
reply.reference: To fulfill the purposes of the processing of Personal data, we share your Personal data with service providers that we have engaged. These suppliers provide services within e.g. IT services (companies that manage necessary operations, technical support and maintenance of our services provided to you and our IT systems). The service providers we have engaged are only allowed to process your Personal data in accordance with our explicit instructions and may not use your data for their own purposes. URL: https://peakpath.com/privacy-policy
